snippet.title: Extreme turbulence on American Airlines flight sends 10 to hospital
snippet.content:
Debris is shown after an American Airlines flight was hit with severe turbulence. Picture: Twitter
New York PostNews Corp Australia Network
Share
It was a flight from hell. at least 10 people were hospitalised after an American Airlines flight from Athens to Philadelphia hit turbulence and became a case study in keeping your seatbelts buckled at all times. Passengers disoriented and relieved, after turbulent American flight from Athens to Philly. "Thirty minutes out, they were giving us our drinks. The flight attendants were in the last couple rows when they said, 'Fasten your seat belts,'" Ian Smith of South Philadelphia told local news station, WPVI. "And then they said for the flight attendants to get to their seats, and they didn't even have time. It started shaking, then it took a big drop. Babies screaming, people in front of us hitting the ceiling," Smith said. Turbulence mess! Flight attendants tossed. I provided medical help (shoulder relocation mid-air).
Passenger Ervin Fang captured the resulting debris-strewn cabin, including drink stains on the bulkhead. "Passengers disoriented and relieved," he tweeted along with the footage.
The cabin was strewn with debris. Picture: TwitterSource:Supplied Flight 759 was carrying 287 passengers and 12 crew members on the weekend when it hit the severe turbulence. "There was just very slight turbulence for about five seconds and then suddenly it felt like the whole plane was in free fall,"New Yorker Alex Ehmke told WPVI. Worst turbulence ever! Athens to Phil. Even the pilot didn't see it coming. Drinks on the ceiling.
Another passenger, Jessica Huseman, tweeted: "They'd just handed out drinks. This plane (that I'm still on) is soaked. Soaked. They'll be hosing this out for hours."
She said one of the flight attendants had dislocated his shoulder.
The plane's ceiling was splattered with various beverages. Picture: TwitterSource:Supplied After landing, three passengers and seven crew members were taken to a hospital. Huseman praised the professionalism of the flight crew, saying, "Impressed w the attendants on this @AmericanAir flight from Athens." Here's the ceiling of the plane
American Airlines released the following statement: "American Airlines flight 759 from Athens, Greece to Philadelphia International Airport briefly encountered severe turbulence shortly before landing safely in Philadelphia. The seat belt sign was on at the time. Three passengers and seven crew members were transported to a local hospital for evaluation. We are taking care of our passengers and our crew members at this time and want to thank our team members for keeping our passengers safe." and is reprinted with permission.
